The window in my office is directly across from the Capitol. So, I watched the mob run up the Capitol steps. I saw the buses that had brought the marauding insurrectionists there. I saw the police officers.

It was a very, very eerie feeling. We were stunned, alarmed, and afraid.

1479217679361884160.text:
At the time, we thought the Capitol might be the safest place to go. But, only Members were allowed in because of COVID precautions.

I told the two staffers with me that day, “I’m not leaving without you.” So, we hunkered down. We bolted and barricaded the door. And we waited.

1479217676551700484.text:
On #January6th, I was in my office in Rayburn when we heard the news that insurrectionists had breached one of the buildings in the Capitol complex.

My staff and I turned to each other and started thinking frantically about what to do — what was our plan? [THREAD]

1468614689634590729.text:
